channel.title: The Sydney Morning Herald National Headlines
channel.description: The top National headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit http://www.smh.com.au.

item.title: Turning boats back works: Sri Lankan envoy
item.description: Asylum seekers will be forced to look for other ways of getting to Australia if their boats are turned back to Sri Lanka, the country's high commissioner says.

item.title: Seven West prepares for capital raising
item.description: Kerry Stokes' Seven West Media has placed its shares in a trading halt, pending the announcement of a capital raising.

item.title: Productivity is up to everyone: Swan
item.description: Productivity is an economy-wide issue that should be tackled by everyone not just government, Treasurer Wayne Swan says.

item.title: Bonds lower after Chinese GDP
item.description: Chinese GDP data released on Friday has kept Australian bond futures prices low heading into the beginning of the week.

item.title: Stocks to watch on Monday
item.description: Stocks of interest on the Australian Securities Exchange on Monday

item.title: Commodities markets summary
item.description: Commodities news from around the world

item.title: International markets roundup
item.description: News from the world’s major stock markets

item.title: Josh Ritter plays 'Folk Bloodbath'
item.description: US singer-songwriter Josh Ritter chats with Martin Boulton and performs Folk Bloodbath.

item.title: Aust shares open higher
item.description: The Australian share market at open on Monday

item.title: Better mobile reception for Sydney trains
item.description: Mobile phone customers will get reception in some Sydney train tunnels from this week - and it's only taken 16 years for the work to be completed.

item.title: $A higher after Chinese GDP
item.description: Better than expected Chinese GDP figures, together with thin volumes ahead of a key central bank sppech in the US, have pushed the Australian dollar higher

item.title: Sci-fi tech coming to a classroom near you
item.description: Touch-screen tables, robot study buddies and 3D virtual learning environments could soon feature in the classroom.

item.title: Sri Lankans reach Christmas Island
item.description: A boat carrying 51 Sri Lankan asylum seekers has arrived at Christmas Island, with the group now expected to have their initial claims for asylum processed there.

item.title: Spirited chaplain aims to keep athletes on track
item.description: WITH more than 10,000 athletes competing at the Olympics and fewer than 10 per cent able to win a medal, the event always brings ''emotional upset and trauma'', says Australia's Olympic chaplain, Nett Knox.

item.title: Hicks's military lawyer dons civvies for Australian law firm
item.description: IN A personal reinvention, the US military lawyer who represented the Guantanamo Bay detainee David Hicks has come to Australia to work as a civilian lawyer.

item.title: Local cafes embrace cordial living with home brews
item.description: IN SOME of Sydney's cafes and restaurants, diners who ask for a bottle of Coke receive a polite but firm refusal.

item.title: Medical care short of best practice: study
item.description: THE first widescale audit of Australian healthcare has found 43 per cent of people are missing out on care in line with best practice or the latest medical advice.

item.title: No longer a case of curse and be damned at work
item.description: WHEN security guard Craig Symes told his manager to ''get f---ed'' his employers felt they had strong grounds to sack him.

item.title: Priest helped by his police friend to bring charges against boy
item.description: AN ARMIDALE priest suspected of child abuse was assisted by a ''mate'' who was a policeman to bring blackmail charges against one his former altar boy victims, court transcripts reveal.

item.title: Medical study reveals some unhealthy results
item.description: The first wide-scale audit of Australian healthcare has found 43 per cent of people are missing out on care in line with best practice or the latest medical advice.

item.title: PM picks her battle: election focus on jobs
item.description: JULIA GILLARD has pushed industrial relations to the forefront as she seeks to define the next election as being about jobs, the economy and the workplace, and not just the carbon tax.

item.title: Queen of the waves is still cresting
item.description: WHEN Stephanie Gilmore won her first world surfing title at age 19, she declared she wanted to win 10. Five years on, the 24-year-old is halfway there after claiming the 2012 Association of Surfing Professionals crown in Biarritz, France, at the weekend.

item.title: Fears over Afghan army, Taliban collusion
item.description: A TALIBAN fighter hiding in a tree is believed to have shot special forces Sergeant Blaine Diddams in an act that has raised fears Afghan soldiers have been collaborating with insurgents.

item.title: Swearing starts a new discussion
item.description: When security guard Craig Symes told his manager to ''get f---ed'' his employers felt they had strong grounds to sack him.

item.title: Asylum seeker boat rescued by commercial ship
item.description: A commercial ship has come to the aid of an ailing boat carrying 27 asylum seekers off the Cocos Islands.

item.title: Guantanamo lawyer Mori moves to Australia
item.description: The US military lawyer who defended Guantanamo detainee David Hicks has moved to Australia and is starting a new job in Melbourne.

item.title: Swans go top as Hawks and Crows fire
item.description: Sydney are top of the AFL ladder, but Adelaide and Hawthorn have also leapt into the top four with big wins in their matches on Sunday.

item.title: Sironen finds voice with Tigers
item.description: Wests Tigers rookie Curtis Sironen says he has to demand the ball more if he wants to make an impact at the NRL level.

item.title: Swans continue winning streak over Eagles
item.description: Sydney's Lewis Jetta has booted four goals to help his side remain at the top of the AFL ladder with a 52-point thrashing of West Coast.

item.title: Flanagan furious over NRL refs calls
item.description: Cronulla coach Shane Flanagan was left fuming after two crucial calls went against his side in Sunday's 18-10 loss to St George Illawarra.

item.title: Hawks surge into AFL top four
item.description: Hawthorn have outscored Western Bulldogs nine goals to one in the second half to score a 72-point win in their round 16 AFL clash.

item.title: PM skips Greens talk at NSW ALP conference
item.description: Greens leader Christine Milne has praised Prime Minister Julia Gillard for not denouncing her party at the NSW Labor conference.

item.title: Carbon price won't work on its own: report
item.description: The Grattan Institute believes the carbon price is "inherently uncertain" because it isn't fixed and relies on the decisions of governments.

item.title: Brumbies' Super fairytale unravels
item.description: The Brumbies are shattered after their fairytale Super Rugby story crumbled in 14 heart-breaking hours on the weekend.

item.title: Dragons slay critics with win over Sharks
item.description: St George Illawarra coach Steve Price claims his side silenced their critics with their 18-10 NRL win over Cronulla at WIN Stadium on Sunday.

item.title: Judd tackle could go straight to tribunal
item.description: The unusual nature of Carlton captain Chris Judd's arm-grab on North Melbourne's Leigh Adams could see it referred straight to the AFL tribunal.

item.title: Crows crush Giants by 119 points
item.description: Adelaide have proven they can kick a big score without key forwards Kurt Tippett and Taylor Walker, demolishing Greater Western Sydney by 119 points.

item.title: Titans eye finals after thumping Raiders
item.description: Gold Coast are within striking distance of the NRL top eight after an impressive 38-26 thumping of Canberra on Sunday.

item.title: Businesses 'under energy cost strain'
item.description: The Australian Industry Group says companies are under pressure from rising energy costs, even though they are improving their energy efficiency.

item.title: Truss appeals to LNP to work against Labor federally
item.description: Nationals leader Warren Truss has told a triumphant LNP party conference that Queensland was fed up with Labor’s mismanagement and that now it was time to spread the sentiment nationally.

item.title: CA chief tells players to adjust to heat
item.description: Cricket Australia chief James Sutherland says players will simply have to adjust to the heat and late-night schedule of the series in Sharjah.

item.title: Cooper to face further SANZAR scrutiny
item.description: Reds five-eighth Quade Cooper's chances of playing in the Super Rugby qualifying final against the Sharks will be decided before a judiciary on Monday.

item.title: Sharing Garden Island sensible: O'Farrell
item.description: NSW Premier Barry O'Farrell says PM Julia Gillard's decision to allow cruise ships to regularly use the Garden Island naval base is a sensible move.

item.title: Truss hopes panel will back opposition on boats
item.description: The coalition will support the recommendations of Angus Houston’s expert panel on asylum seekers - if the panel recommends coalition policies.

item.title: Qantas motion moved at Labor conference
item.description: The Transport Workers Union is moving a NSW Labor conference motion to expand the Qantas Sale Act to include Jetstar.

item.title: World's deadliest shark coast hits tourism
item.description: WA authorities want open season on great white sharks following the fifth fatality in 10 months on the southwest coast.

item.title: Lions ready for morale-boosted Suns
item.description: Brisbane say they won't be taking Queensland rivals Gold Coast lightly next week, after the Suns scored their first AFL win of the season.

item.title: Souths out to avenge opening round loss
item.description: South Sydney coach Michael Maguire claims his side learned a tough lesson from their round one NRL loss to Sydney Roosters ahead of Monday's rematch.

item.title: PM applauded for declaring she will fight
item.description: Prime Minister Julia Gillard has told the NSW Labor conference that she will not 'lie down and die' despite recent poor polling.

item.title: Mundine eyes Mayweather after McKart TKO
item.description: Anthony Mundine believes he's made steps towards taking on unbeaten Floyd Mayweather Jr following his impressive win over Bronco McKart.

item.title: Foley lays down law to Tahs' Wallabies
item.description: The NSW Waratahs have been challenged to make big sacrifices to turnaround their Super Rugby fortunes after a terrible 2012 campaign.

item.title: I don't care about Hasler: Toovey
item.description: Newcastle coach Wayne Bennett says Manly remain a firm chance of scoring back-to-back NRL titles despite their stuttering premiership defence.

item.title: Hard works pays off for St Kilda's Saad
item.description: Former junior soccer player Ahmed Saad is starting to find his feet with St Kilda in the AFL.

item.title: Force to wait on Cheika coach offer
item.description: Heineken Cup-winning coach Michael Cheika is weighing up whether to take up the top job at Super Rugby strugglers the Western Force.

item.title: PM wants states to help fund pay rise
item.description: Prime Minister Julia Gillard has announced an extra $1 billion in federal money to fund pay rises in the community and social sector.

item.title: Iluka boss defends dire outlook
item.description: Iluka managing director David Robb has defended his decision to tell the market of his dire short-term outlook for the global economy.

item.title: Carr takes fresh aim at Russia over Syria
item.description: Foreign Minister Bob Carr says Australia is appalled by the latest massacre in Syria.

item.title: Storm's NRL backline depth tested
item.description: Melbourne's hopes of snapping a three-game losing streak have suffered a blow with exciting winger Matt Duffie joining Billy Slater on the sidelines.

item.title: Collingwood's Pendlebury returns in style
item.description: Collingwood's Scott Pendlebury showed little sign of rustiness in a stellar AFL return in the Magpies' 31-point win over Geelong.

item.title: Garden Island to host cruise ships: PM
item.description: Sydney's Garden Island naval base will host cruise ships, Prime Minister Julia Gillard says, only months after a review criticised the idea.

item.title: Police search for body of shark victim
item.description: A man has been killed by a shark in Western Australia - the state's fifth fatal attack since September last year.

item.title: Web hate fuels custody battle
item.description: THE international custody battle over four sisters has spilt into cyberspace, with supporters of the estranged parents setting up warring Facebook pages and accusing each other of stalking, harassment and theft.

item.title: Gatto lays off workers
item.description: Mick Gatto has laid off about 20 staff from his Melbourne company Elite Cranes over the past week amid concerns the embattled business could be placed into administration.

item.title: Joint task force on terrorism
item.description: LAW enforcement agencies from Australia and the US have signed an agreement to fight organised crime and terrorism, the Home Affairs Minister, Jason Clare, said.

item.title: Farmers hit by drought of skilled workers
item.description: FORGET about a wife. Australian farmers want employees. The big wet has broken the worst drought in a century, but the resulting boom has exposed a failing labour market.

item.title: HIV no longer means certain death
item.description: No cure is in sight but patients now live a rich and normal life.

item.title: Paying the price for credit card blowout
item.description: AUSTRALIANS' credit cards are being slugged with one of the highest interest rates in the world.

item.title: Warne forms great partnership with teenage refugee
item.description: HE WAS an asylum seeker on a leaking boat intercepted near Christmas Island. But now 17-year-old Jaffar Ali counts Shane Warne among his high-profile supporters, after three years living in Australia.

item.title: Frightened girlfriend breaks her silence
item.description: Before her first trip to Kings Cross, Tom Kelly's young girlfriend sent him a text message. She confessed to being scared about going clubbing on Saturday night, but he soothed her anxiety.

item.title: Whitsunday storms create holiday chaos
item.description: HUNDREDS of travellers to the Whitsunday Islands have been stranded and forced to seek accommodation due to poor weather shutting down local airports.

item.title: Shire gets makeover
item.description: It's got Botox, boob jobs, blondes, surfies and romance. But don't expect one mention of the Cronulla riots in Ten's new show The Shire, because its creators have determinedly left out any reference to the controversial event.

item.title: Wheels still turn in city's playground
item.description: Ilya Gridneff reports on a night out at the Cross, where it's business as usual.

item.title: Defence coy on front-line women
item.description: The Australian Defence Force says it has no sense of how many female soldiers are interested in combat roles.

item.title: Full honours for fallen Digger
item.description: An Australian special forces soldier killed in Afghanistan this month is described at his funeral as 'humble', 'loyal' and 'respectful' by his commanding officer.

item.title: The case against legalising same-sex marriage
item.description: They say they are not against homosexuals. Nor are they bigots, or religious zealots or people hankering after a bygone era. What they are against is same-sex marriage.

item.title: Juvenile offenders in sights
item.description: THE Queensland LNP government will not be afraid to act counter to the rest of Australia on juvenile crime, the Attorney-General, Jarrod Bleijie, has warned.

item.title: Minorities voice anger at changes
item.description: MORE than 100 brightly dressed and loud members of the Queensland gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgendered and inter-gendered community stood outside the entrance to the Hilton Hotel in Brisbane yesterday protesting against the LNP's changes to civil union legislation and proposed changes to surrogacy laws.

item.title: Few workers to harvest
item.description: FORGET about a wife. Australian farmers want workers.

item.title: Rebels fall short against Super Stormers
item.description: Melbourne Rebels were unable to send retiring skipper Stirling Mortlock out a winner, falling to Super Rugby leaders the Stormers 26-21 in Cape Town.

item.title: Doubts raised over boxer's gender
item.description: A FEMALE boxer from Thailand recorded "highly suspicious" levels of testosterone before a world title fight in Melbourne on Friday night, again plunging the sport into controversy.

item.title: Saints get home over Lions
item.description: St Kilda have climbed back into the AFL top eight with a 13-point win over Brisbane at the Gabba.

item.title: Steffensen racism spray a shame, say AA
item.description: John Steffensen says he has been racially vilified by Athletics Australia over their decision to give teenager Steve Solomon an individual 400m spot.

item.title: Collingwood beat Cats by 31 points
item.description: Collingwood's AFL top four hopes have been buoyed with a comfortable 31-point win over reigning premiers Geelong at the MCG.

item.title: Aust up to No.2 in Test rankings
item.description: Australia have moved up to second on the ICC Test rankings after the yearly adjustment to the points by the sport's governing body.

item.title: Reds storm into Super finals
item.description: Super Rugby champions Queensland have booked an unlikely home play-off with a five-tries-to-two win over the NSW Waratahs.

item.title: Tigers sneak past Panthers 26-18 in NRL
item.description: Wests Tigers have beaten Penrith 26-18 in the NRL clash at Campbelltown.

item.title: Bennett's 'new era' Knights stun Manly
item.description: Manly coach Geoff Toovey has refused to blame injuries and illness for his team's upset NRL loss to Newcastle.

item.title: Hunt goal clinches Suns' win over Tigers
item.description: Gold Coast's Karmichael Hunt says kicking a goal after the siren to clinch an AFL win over Richmond is among his greatest sporting moments.

item.title: Storm still smiling despite Cowboys loss
item.description: Melbourne Storm coach Craig Bellamy believes his table-topping side is showing signs of improvement despite falling to their third successive loss.

item.title: Crusaders beat Force, Sharpe farewelled
item.description: Nathan Sharpe's final Super Rugby game couldn't inspire the Force to victory as the Crusaders ran rampant in the first half.

item.title: Brumbies back Tahs after loss to Blues
item.description: Brumbies coach Jake White believes their season will be a failure if they don't make the finals - a real possibility after they lost 30-16 to the Blues.

item.title: Military honours for fallen SAS soldier
item.description: The Australian special forces soldier killed in Afghanistan earlier this month has been farewelled will full military honours in Perth.

item.title: Gumbleton stands tall as Bombers beat Port
item.description: Essendon coach James Hird has hailed the AFL comeback of Scott Gumbleton in the Bombers' 50-point win over Port Adelaide.

item.title: Fremantle fight back to down Demons
item.description: Fremantle have kicked the last nine goals of the match to score an ultimately comfortable AFL win over Melbourne at Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Boxer Dib eyeing fight in US
item.description: IBF featherweight champion Billy Dib is eyeing a potential defence against unbeaten American Gary Russell after a victory in Sydney on Friday night.

item.title: 'Tip top' Mundine promises flair in Vegas
item.description: Anthony Mundine is intent on impressing American fight fans with his performance against Bronco McKart following the longest layoff of his boxing career.

item.title: Petero in fine form: Broncos coach
item.description: Brisbane coach Anthony Griffin says veteran prop Petero Civoniceva is warming up like "an old bus" as his NRL career draws to a close.

item.title: LNP chief backs party treasurer
item.description: Bruce McIver says he has full confidence in LNP treasurer Barry O'Sullivan, who has been criticised for reviewing the books of government businesses.

item.title: Now or never for Dragons: Creagh
item.description: St George Illawarra back-rower Ben Creagh says the Dragons have to beat Cronulla on Sunday if they are to be any chance of playing in the NRL finals.

item.title: Clive Palmer offers hope to sacked journos
item.description: Mining magnate Clive Palmer is seriously considering launching an online news service to be staffed by sacked Fairfax journalists.
